sentences.english: “We don’t observe more mergers in the AGN host galaxies,” Cisternas said.
sentences.chinese: 我們沒有觀測更多AGN母星系的吞併。

sentences.english: Did the star ignite helium at the core, swallow a planet, or swallow a companion star?
sentences.chinese: 星體燃燒了核內的氦，吞併了行星或伴星嗎？

sentences.english: Originally settled by Scythians, it was annexed by Russia in1784. Population, 331, 000.
sentences.chinese: 最初西西亞人在此定居，1784年被俄羅斯吞併。

sentences.english: Japan seized Ryukyu in 1879 and changed its name to Okinawa Prefecture.
sentences.chinese: 1879年，日本吞併琉球並改稱沖繩縣。

sentences.english: Small family business is often - (3) - up by larger firm.
sentences.chinese: 小的家族企業常被大公司吞併。

sentences.english: A huge multi-national swallowed up the business.
sentences.chinese: 一家大型的多國公司吞併了這家企業。

sentences.english: The empire absorbed many small nations.
sentences.chinese: 該帝國吞併了許多小國。

sentences.english: Most of the Kumemura wanted war with Japan during annexation.
sentences.chinese: 大多數華族琉球人在日本吞併戰爭時被通緝。

sentences.english: Cannibalization is not something we are spending one minute on here.
sentences.chinese: 我們不願浪費一分鐘用在吞併市場上。

sentences.english: The iPod gobbled up 85 percent of the music-player market.
sentences.chinese: iPod吞併了音樂播放器85%的市場份額。

sentences.english: Japan annexed what it says were unclaimed islands in 1895.
sentences.chinese: 日本於1895年吞併了其所謂的無人認領的島嶼。

sentences.english: Nazi Germany nearly swallowed up the whole Europe in World War Ⅱ.
sentences.chinese: 第二次世界大戰中，納粹德國幾乎吞併了整個歐洲。

sentences.english: The colonialists stubbornly defended their annexations with fire and sword.
sentences.chinese: 殖民主義者大肆燒殺，頑固防守他們吞併的領土。

sentences.english: “There’s no magic algorithm that will tell you if a galaxy is merging,” said Mauricio Cisternas, a graduate student at the Max-Planck Institute and lead author of the paper.
sentences.chinese: 沒有神奇的算法可以告訴你星系是否正在吞併。

sentences.english: The Bandidos was one of the only groups in Canada that was swallowed by the Hell's Angels.
sentences.chinese: 迪多斯是加拿大唯一被地獄天使吞併的車隊。

definition: Treaty of Shimonoseki (1895), concluding the First Sino-Japanese War 甲午戰爭|甲午战争[Jia3 wu3 Zhan4 zheng1]

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
to open up land for cultivation/to garrison troops to open up land
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
